p:
Adult patients were included in the study if they were hospitalized for AIS between April 1, 2021 and September 30, 2022 and had a diagnosis of COVID-19 up to 30 days before the diagnosis of AIS (Fig. 2). The TriNetX codes used to identify COVID-19 diagnosis, AIS, and hospitalization are available in Supplementary Table S1. Patients were excluded from the study if (1) hospitalization for AIS occurred before April 1, 2021 or after September 30, 2022 or (2) there was no COVID-19 diagnosis within 30 days before hospitalization for AIS.Fig. 2Study design.
Patients hospitalized with a diagnosis of AIS and who had COVID-19 infection in the preceding one month were categorized into two groups based on COVID-19 vaccination status. They were compared at 7 and 30 days after admission for the outcomes of interest listed.
